nd

rd
shifts

Corporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability and excellence

$21.73 + shift differential ($0.44 for 2nd shift & $0.49 for 3rd shift)
- After training and the probationary period, pay could be between the range of $23.28 and $27.79.

, and 10 days of paid holidays, subject to annual change. Your actual pay will be based on your work location and other factors, such as your skills, experience, and education. www.westrock.com/company/careers

Description & Requirements
Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
The Opportunity:
This role supports day-to-day manufacturing operations by working as part of a production team responsible for packaging and assembling finished products. The position contributes directly to meeting customer demand by ensuring products are packaged accurately, efficiently, and safely.
The scope of this role includes operating within assigned production areas, supporting line operations, performing basic quality checks, and maintaining a clean and organized work environment. Employees in this role follow established procedures while learning production processes and safety expectations.
A typical day may include loading and unloading materials, packaging finished products, inspecting items for quality, assembling boxes or skids, rotating between tasks as needed, and collaborating with teammates and supervisors to meet production goals.
How You Will Impact Smurfit Westrock:
Support daily production operations by packaging and assembling finished products according to established standards
Perform basic quality checks to help ensure products meet customer and company requirements
Maintain a clean, organized, and safe work area to support overall plant safety and efficiency
Follow safety rules, policies, and procedures to reduce risk and prevent incidents
Work collaboratively with team members and supervisors to meet production schedules
Adapt to changing production needs, including task rotation and overtime when required
What You Need to Succeed:
Required Qualifications:
High School Diploma or GED
Ability to work effectively in a team-based manufacturing environment
Ability to learn and follow safety rules, policies, and operating procedures
Ability to communicate effectively with supervisors and coworkers
Ability to work overtime as needed during peak production periods
Ability to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation
Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities:
Basic attention to detail for quality inspection and packaging accuracy
Willingness to learn production processes and equipment
Ability to follow written and verbal instructions
Commitment to maintaining a safe work environment
Preferred Qualifications:
Prior experience in manufacturing, production, or warehouse environments
Familiarity with basic quality inspection or packaging processes
Behavioral Competencies:
Dependable and reliable attendance
Willingness to learn and accept coaching
Team-oriented mindset
Safety-focused approach to work
What We Offer:
A corporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability, and excellence
Comprehensive training with learning and development opportunities
Competitive compensation reflecting skills, experience, and potential
A career with a global packaging company where sustainability, safety, and inclusion are core to daily operations

Description & Requirements
Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
The Opportunity:
The Class A Commercial Driver position involves driving a company tractor and trailer to deliver products to our customers. Driver routes will typically be 4-10 stops per route, will require the driver to unload via lift gate with pallet jack, and transport/place palletized products inside the customers’ location. Drivers will be expected to use ELD and log all activity and follow all state and federal regulations. Routes are generally <150 miles round trip but could be longer including interstate depending on DC location.
$29-$31/hr
M-F 6a to completion – Averaging 8-12 hrs of overtime per week
HIRING NOW
GREAT BENEFITS
HOME EVERY NIGHT
FULL TIME
VETERANS ENCOURAGED TO APPLY
How you will impact Smurfit Westrock
:
Safely operates tractor and trailer for the delivery of products and materials.
Perform vehicle inspections as required.
Operate mobile apps on the phone for ELD and proof of delivery.
Provide outstanding customer service during delivery.
Follow all safety rules for equipment and material handling as required by DOT, OSHA and Company safety program.
Ensure all orders are delivered in good condition and in full as per the bill of lading.
Communicate effectively with operations staff about customer concerns.
Utilize material handling equipment, such hand trucks
Must be able to do load/offload with Pallet Jack will be certified on site for Forklift
What you need to succeed:
Current CDL Class A license
No preventable motor vehicle violations within the last 12 months
Current medical certification card.
3 years’ experience driving a tractor trailer.
General fluency in English required, verbal and written
Basic computer literacy preferred
High school diploma or equivalent preferred
Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Perform job duties in severe weather conditions: heat, cold, rain, etc.
Sit and drive for up to 10 hours of time without assistance.
Lift 50 pounds repeatedly and without assistance or equipment.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision and ability to adjust focus.
Work Environment
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
The work environment is usually moderate to noisy.

Description & Requirements
Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
Electrical Maintenance Technician – Winston-Salem, NC
Shift: 3rd shift - 11pm to 7am
The Opportunity:
As an Electrical Maintenance Technician, you will be responsible for supporting the operation of a fast-paced packaging manufacturing facility.  The ideal candidate must be able to conduct, maintain, test and repair electrical/electronic, mechanical, hydraulic, and pneumatic systems and components.  Must be able to apply knowledge of electrical/mechanical principles in determining equipment malfunctions and restore in all areas of Manufacturing.
Primary duties include the install, start up and shut down of equipment in accordance with company safety procedures for machine activation and shutdown in line with OSHA requirements; inform appropriate management and line mechanics of potential electrical/mechanical problems and inherent dangers involved and maintain company-required performance and maintenance records for identified equipment.  The job also includes performing preventative maintenance functions as directed, assisting maintenance personnel with technical troubleshooting, and performing other duties as required. The ideal candidate will have a strong commitment to working safely and demonstrate the ability to work in a fast-paced environment, possess a strong desire to learn the maintenance of complex machinery, and have a desire to advance within the company.
What you need to succeed:
High school diploma or equivalent required
Minimum of 3 years’ electrical maintenance experience in industrial or manufacturing setting
Military training and/or technical school preferred
, but not required.
Computer experience/operation and PLC Programming
Must be available to work 3
rd
shift.
Ability to maintain various manufacturing equipment, follow specific directions, and perform other duties as assigned.
Ability to work safely, maintain a clean and safe work environment, and comply with all safety regulations.
A thorough knowledge of electrical components and equipment including the use of special instruments for diagnostic purposes
What we offer:
Corporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability, and excellence.
Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities.
An attractive salary reflecting skills, competencies and potential; the rate for this position ranging from $23.00 - $30.00 hour with an attractive benefits package plus shift differential for both 2nd and 3rd shift.
A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of daily work.

Description & Requirements
Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
The Opportunity
Support manufacturing and warehouse operations by safely receiving, storing, and shipping finished goods in accordance with established procedures
Serve as a key link between production, warehouse, and transportation to ensure accurate, timely movement of materials and finished products
Perform daily shipping and receiving activities while maintaining safety, quality, and inventory accuracy
Contribute to a safe and organized warehouse environment by following safety standards, maintaining housekeeping, and identifying potential hazards
A typical day includes operating forklifts, inspecting loads, entering inventory transactions, preparing shipping paperwork, performing inspections, and supporting inventory counts
How You Will Impact Smurfit Westrock
Follow all safety procedures and model safe work practices at all times
Identify and report near misses, incidents, unsafe conditions, or hazards immediately
Ensure compliance with applicable safety and workplace standards
Maintain reliable attendance and demonstrate flexibility to work overtime during busy periods
Perform daily forklift inspections and operate forklifts safely and efficiently
Load, secure, and prepare finished goods for shipment according to shipping requirements
Stretch wrap finished goods and work-in-process pallets as needed to support production flow
Enter finished goods into inventory systems and store pallets in designated warehouse locations
Maintain and update inventory records and support cycle counts and month-end inventories
Complete daily shipping and receiving logs and required paperwork accurately and on time
Inspect inbound and outbound trucks and loads using established inspection procedures
Support warehouse housekeeping by maintaining cleanliness of assigned areas and equipment
Inspect warehouse areas for contamination, damage, or conditions that could impact product safety
Report product safety or quality concerns to leadership promptly
Provide backup support for other warehouse and forklift roles as needed
What You Need to Succeed
Qualifications / Requirements
Ability to work safely in a warehouse and manufacturing environment
Ability to operate a forklift and successfully complete required forklift training and certification
Basic computer skills with the ability to enter and track inventory data
Ability to read, write, and complete shipping and receiving documentation
Ability to perform physical tasks including lifting, moving, and securing materials
Strong attention to detail related to inventory accuracy, load security, and documentation
Willingness and ability to work overtime as needed, including during peak periods
Reliable attendance and punctuality
Ability to perform essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation
Preferred / Desired Skills and Attributes
Prior experience in shipping, receiving, warehouse, or manufacturing environments
Experience with inventory management or warehouse systems
Knowledge of shipping documentation and bill of lading processes
Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks
Commitment to safety, quality, and teamwork
Willingness to provide backup support for supervisory or lead responsibilities as needed
What We Offer
Corporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability, and excellence
Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities
An attractive salary reflecting skills, competencies, and potential
A career with a global packaging company where sustainability, safety, and inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of daily work

description_text:
General Information
Job ID
ATR58311
Posting Job Title
Financial Compliance Quality & Technology Analyst
Locations
GA Atlanta Headquarters
Employment Type
Full Time
Date Posted
30-Jan-2026
Relocation Support

Description & Requirements
Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
Financial Compliance Quality and Technology Analyst – Atlanta, GA
The opportunity:
This role will report to the Sr. Director, North America (NA) Compliance, and will be responsible for performing key technology and quality activities supporting the US, Canada, and Mexico compliance teams.
The ideal candidate should have strong programming or application development skills to assist in designing and implementing solutions within the team’s compliance application as well as maintaining dashboards for key metrics. The ideal candidate should have strong skills for working with individuals across an organization. The candidate should have an understanding in a distributed manufacturing environment with the skills necessary to influence people in a global company.
How you will impact Smurfit WestRock:
The ideal candidate will support Smurfit Westrock in three key areas:
AuditBoard Administration & Support
Serve as the primary point of contact for AuditBoard-related inquiries and troubleshooting.
Assist in implementing new modules, dashboards, workflows, and enhancements within AuditBoard that support the NA Compliance activities.
Provide training and guidance to team members on AuditBoard functionality and best practices.
Remain current on new functionality offered by AuditBoard or advise on new approaches to make the compliance activities as efficient as possible.
Quality Review & Documentation
Conduct thorough reviews of compliance documentation to ensure accuracy, completeness, and adherence to internal policies and procedures.
Identify gaps or inconsistencies and collaborate with team members to resolve issues.
Maintain templates and guidelines for compliance documentation.
Departmental Support & Coordination
Enhance departmental reporting by creating visuals for reports, such as graphs, charts, and diagrams; engage with the compliance team to identify areas where support can be provided on finalizing reports efficiently.
Maintain key dashboards and metrics to track compliance activities and performance that will also for ease of reporting to regional leadership.
What you need to succeed:
Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy in documentation and processes.
Ability to learn and manage compliance technology platforms, particularly AuditBoard.
Excellent organizational skills to handle multiple priorities and deadlines.
Communicates clearly and effectively for collaborating across teams.
Proactive mindset with problem-solving capabilities and willingness to take on various initiatives.
Possesses the ability to work in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment.
Assists in providing training and guidance to internal team on the AuditBoard application and internal policies and procedures.
Essential qualifications and education:
4-6 years of general business experience; relevant experience in areas of software maintenance/training, technical writing, compliance, and reporting
BA/BS in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration or related field.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills, with demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor
Proficient in Microsoft-Office (Very strong skills in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Power Platform)
System implementation experience is a plus
Strong skills with working with SharePoint, QlikCloud, SQL Databases, Alteryx
Experience with AuditBoard is a plus
Strong communication skills, interpersonal skills, and presentation skills that allow effective interactions/communications with business partners across regional and/or functional lines
What we offer:
Corporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability and excellence
Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities
An attractive salary reflecting skills, competencies and potential
A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work
Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.

Description & Requirements
Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
The Opportunity:
The Maintenance Manager is responsible for providing expertise and leadership to the service and maintenance staff while ensuring the safe maintenance, repair or replacement of plant assets. The Maintenance Manager is also responsible for driving continuous improvement of plant operations to enable efficient, high-quality production of customer products.
How you will impact Smurfit WestRock:
Provide strategic leadership on maintenance operations to ensure maximum production.
Develop and implement the short- and long-term maintenance strategy to enable operating efficiency in alignment with Smurfit WestRock’s values.
Create Maintenance Department safety goals and plan to ensure a safe work environment.
Create an effective Plant Maintenance Program using industry best practices to maximize equipment reliability and uptime.
Supervise and inspect maintenance work to ensure the most effective, efficient and up to date technology and preferred maintenance practices are implemented by craftsmen.
Manage and analyze maintenance department KPIs to assess operating efficiency and identify opportunities to drive performance excellence.
Monitor and communicate departmental performance in Safety, Environmental, Reliability, and cost effectiveness.
Provide guidance in the development of the maintenance business plan and forecasts.
Lead maintenance staff to exceed industry standards and set new industry uptime and reliability standards.
Serve as a member of the Plant Leadership Team to align on Plant goals and standards and collaborate on organizational effectiveness.
Negotiate using win-win strategies on behalf of Smurfit Westrock with the Labor Union representatives on contract issues.
Ensure a safe work environment and adherence to all corporate, state and federal safety, health and environmental policies, procedures and regulations by all maintenance staff.
Foster a culture of care that promotes active participation and buy-in for safety and maintenance reliability from craftsmen.
Ensure maintenance staff is adequately trained and motivated to achieve departmental objectives in a safe, timely, and cost-effective manner.
Leads and motivates a team of people to achieve performance excellence; ability to read people and situations and adjust approach; accordingly, proactively leads and enforces initiatives that drive organizational effectiveness; teaches others how to build trust-based relationships.
Uses strong problem-solving skills and supporting information to arrive at optimal decisions in an appropriate timeframe; knows when to decide and/or when to seek additional input, and drive for consensus.
What you need to succeed:
2-year technical degree in Electrical, Mechanical, or Industrial Engineering - Required
Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical and/or Mechanical Engineering - Preferred
10+ years of experience in industrial maintenance with 5+ years in maintenance management - Required
Proficient with various software packages such as Microsoft Office - Excel, Outlook, JDE, PLC / DCS or similar CMMS (Computerized Maintenance Management System.
What we offer:
Corporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability, and excellence.
Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities.
An attractive salary reflecting skills, competencies, and potential.
Benefits package to include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401k with match, tuition reimbursement, employee discounts, employee referral bonus, and much more!
A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work.
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by state or federal law.
The salary range for this position is $99,375.00 - $165,625.00, depending on your role, level, and location. The range listed is also the expected pay for roles in Illinois and Colorado. The benefits for this role include short-term bonus incentive, health, dental and vision insurance, flexible spending accounts or health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and paid sick leave as required by applicable state/local law, 10 days of paid vacation, and 11 days of paid holidays, subject to annual change. :

Balances financial and non-financial indicators

Serve as the facilitator to their business partners on decision making processes that drive working capital improvements or that prevent negative impacts.
Ad Hoc Analysis
Plant Comps in performance to other “like” plants or businesses
Profitability Improvement programs if the plant is on an improvement plan
Compiling and Delivering Plant visit decks to Senior leadership during onsite or Teams meetings.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. GENERAL PURPOSE: The Gluer Operator makes ready gluer based on carton size and style and completes production run for maximum quality and efficiency.  The Gluer Operator is accountable for all aspects of gluer performance; will lead, give directions, monitor work of their machine crew and compliance with PPE and safety guidelines.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
•
Demonstrates competency in all basic and advanced folds, straight line, auto bottom, internals, and inner partitions.
•
Reviews job order to determine specifications and/or special instructions for job and examines approved sample to determine gluing areas, folding areas and pre-breaks required to produce carton.
•
Performs line clearance according to established QOP.
•
Reviews job order to determine specifications and/or special instructions for job and examines approved sample to determine gluing areas, folding areas and pre-breaks required to produce carton.
•
Sets and makes adjustments to gluer to achieve specifications.
•
Makes determination as to the number of cartons to pack in case to provide consistent case counts.
•
Examines glue pot and if necessary, clean, check level of glue in glue pot on all gluers and in drum for extrusion.
•
Sets barcode scanner; challenges barcode scanner to ensure proper function and Vision system when applicable.
•
Sets glue scanner; challenges glue scanner to ensure proper function.
•
Throughout production run, perform checks to ensure cartons are folding properly and glue application is consistent and accurate.  Monitors identification bars on multiple order jobs to prevent mixed items.
•
Ensures any non-conforming materials are identified.
•
Sets up and runs tag machines for jobs that require tags or labels.
•
Assists in the repair and preventative maintenance of gluers.
•
Conforms with and abides by all regulations, policies, work procedures, safety rules, security procedures and instructions.
•
This position will help keep department in specs within all 5S and SQF guidelines, and immediately report any food safety concerns to management.
•
Performs other job duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS:
•
Good basic computer skills in order to utilize our operating systems.
•
Good problem-solving skills.
•
Ability to follow written and verbal instructions.
•
Good communicator and able to monitor finishing team members to enable them to perform assigned responsibilities accurately.
•
Must have working knowledge of finishing machine (gluer) and mechanical aptitude.
•
Ability to work in team environment.
•
Ability to work with little supervision.
•
Good attendance record.
•
Must pass color vision test.
•
Good mathematical ability, including good understanding of measurement systems and ability to utilize various measuring devices, e.g., calipers, micrometers, etc.
•
3-years' experience operating a gluer or successfully completing a formalized on the job training program or equivalent combination.
•
Must be able to perform all essential functions of this job with or without reasonable accommodation.

Description & Requirements
Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
The opportunity:
We are seeking a Business Finance & Accounting leader that will report to the Director of Finance -HBH.  This individual will be responsible for the Dallas Cartons manufacturing plant and will provide analysis, insights into recommendations, and help drive improvements in operations, sales, and the overall profitability of the plant. The Business Finance & Accounting Leader will be a business partner to the site General Manager and accountable for the bottom-line results of the facility.
How you will impact Smurfit Westrock
:
Budget & Financial preparation and reporting.
Prepares annual budget and quarterly forecasts in conjunction with the plant General manager with a goal of forecast accuracy.
Utilize KPI’s and plant initiatives to project future plant growth opportunities, encourage going beyond just the traditional product cost.
Collaboration with Commercial Business leads to challenge and validation of top line revenue expectations.
The Business Finance and Accounting Leader should be able to effectively communicate the organization’s values.
Creates simplified budget and reporting processes.
Balances financial and non-financial indicators
Clearly reports and articulates key impactful items to the business results.
Serves as a consultant to business partners to help develop action plans for improvement.
Cost Take out support, review and tracking.
Strategic Planning (CAPEX)
Partner with the General Manger on future and long-range Capital needs to sustain and or grow the sites business opportunities.
Understand competitor strengths and weaknesses.
Internal Controls
The Business Finance and Accounting Leader is accountable for overseeing all internal controls and failures of the site(s).
They ensure decisions are made by those with authority to do so.
They ensure key processes follow documented company policies.
They ensure adequate control over the company’s local assets and financial reporting.
They find the right balance between effectiveness in value creation and control efficiency.
Responsible for optimizing processes through IT improvement and implementation.
Drive process improvements through the utilization of best practices across the organization.
Profitability Analysis
Leverage data systems to provide ongoing customer profitability analysis to help catch and correct margin erosion.
Facilitate open discussion among business leaders on how to drive more margin through volume, price or operational changes.
Accounting
Actively review and validate plant WIP, Finished Goods and raw materials values.
Creation and/or review of site monthly Journal Entries
Review P&L accounts for the necessary reclassification of costs.
Facilitate and assist with plant inventory counts, count verifications and reconciliation processes.
Other tasks as deemed necessary
Working Capital/ Cash flow monitoring
Serve as the facilitator to their business partners on decision making processes that drive working capital improvements or that prevent negative impacts.
Ad Hoc Analysis
Plant Comps in performance to other “like” plants or businesses
Profitability Improvement programs if the plant is on an improvement plan
Compiling and Delivering Plant visit decks to Senior leadership during onsite or Teams meetings.
This set of duties is not intended to be a catch-all for the other ad hoc requests of the plant and or the division’s needs.
What you need to succeed:
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance; MBA or CMA strongly preferred.
A minimum of 5 years of related experience in Pulp and Paper industry or manufacturing is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Advanced skills in Excel, Hyperion SmartView; experience with QlikView a plus
Strong understanding of key metrics
Large capital project financial management preferred.
Detailed oriented team player who can consistently meet deadlines, adapt quickly, work well with all levels of the organization, and possess the ability to work independently as needed.
Strong interpersonal, communication, computer, and team building skills.
Strong organizational skills and ability to multitask in a continuously changing environment.
What we offer:
Corporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability, and excellence
Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities
An attractive salary reflecting skills, competencies and potential
A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work.

Description & Requirements
Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
GENERAL PURPOSE: The Gluer Operator makes ready gluer based on carton size and style and completes production run for maximum quality and efficiency.  The Gluer Operator is accountable for all aspects of gluer performance; will lead, give directions, monitor work of their machine crew and compliance with PPE and safety guidelines.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
•
Demonstrates competency in all basic and advanced folds, straight line, auto bottom, internals, and inner partitions.
•
Reviews job order to determine specifications and/or special instructions for job and examines approved sample to determine gluing areas, folding areas and pre-breaks required to produce carton.
•
Performs line clearance according to established QOP.
•
Reviews job order to determine specifications and/or special instructions for job and examines approved sample to determine gluing areas, folding areas and pre-breaks required to produce carton.
•
Sets and makes adjustments to gluer to achieve specifications.
•
Makes determination as to the number of cartons to pack in case to provide consistent case counts.
•
Examines glue pot and if necessary, clean, check level of glue in glue pot on all gluers and in drum for extrusion.
•
Sets barcode scanner; challenges barcode scanner to ensure proper function and Vision system when applicable.
•
Sets glue scanner; challenges glue scanner to ensure proper function.
•
Throughout production run, perform checks to ensure cartons are folding properly and glue application is consistent and accurate.  Monitors identification bars on multiple order jobs to prevent mixed items.
•
Ensures any non-conforming materials are identified.
•
Sets up and runs tag machines for jobs that require tags or labels.
•
Assists in the repair and preventative maintenance of gluers.
•
Conforms with and abides by all regulations, policies, work procedures, safety rules, security procedures and instructions.
•
This position will help keep department in specs within all 5S and SQF guidelines, and immediately report any food safety concerns to management.
•
Performs other job duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS:
•
Good basic computer skills in order to utilize our operating systems.
•
Good problem-solving skills.
•
Ability to follow written and verbal instructions.
•
Good communicator and able to monitor finishing team members to enable them to perform assigned responsibilities accurately.
•
Must have working knowledge of finishing machine (gluer) and mechanical aptitude.
•
Ability to work in team environment.
•
Ability to work with little supervision.
•
Good attendance record.
•
Must pass color vision test.
•
Good mathematical ability, including good understanding of measurement systems and ability to utilize various measuring devices, e.g., calipers, micrometers, etc.
•
3-years' experience operating a gluer or successfully completing a formalized on the job training program or equivalent combination.
•
Must be able to perform all essential functions of this job with or without reasonable accommodation.

Strong collaboration and teaming skills with stakeholders across functions

On-shift resource for troubleshooting problems in the process as well as maintenance issues.

Quality work is essential and is built into your training plan. You’ll learn how to do incorporate quality checks and verifications into your daily tasks.

We value team members who show up on time, stay focused, and take pride in doing quality work.
Following instructions and paying attention to detail
are important parts of staying safe and successful in this role.
Schedule Flexibility
You’ll work a modified southern
swing shift
, meaning your schedule will rotate between day and night 12-hour shifts, including some weekends. This setup gives you
built-in days off
and helps keep things balanced over time.
We sometimes need extra help to meet production goals, so being
open to overtime or occasional short-notice shifts
is a big plus.
We understand life happens, and we work with you as best we can.
Team Player Mindset
This is a team-focused environment, so strong
communication skills
, a
positive attitude
, and the ability to
work well with others
will help you thrive.
What You Can Look Forward To
A
competitive hourly wage
that reflects your skills and your potential to grow with us.
Comprehensive, hands-on
training and development
to help you build the skills you need for a long-term career.
A supportive, team-focused workplace where integrity, respect, accountability, and excellence are part of everything we do.
Being part of a global leader in
sustainable packaging solutions
, where Safety, Sustainability, and Inclusion aren’t just words — they’re values we live by.
Plenty of opportunities to learn and grow through ongoing
training programs and career development
resources.
A chance to build a meaningful career where your efforts make a real impact.
Start Building Your Future with Us
At Smurfit Westrock, we believe in investing in our people. This trainee role is your chance to gain valuable experience, develop new skills, and grow your career with a company that truly cares about your success. If you’re ready to bring your positive attitude and strong work ethic to a supportive team, apply today and take the first step toward a bright future!

Description & Requirements
Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
Job Summary:
The Senior Assistant Customer Service Coordinator represents WestRock to the customer and acts as a critical liaison between the customer, sales, and operations teams. The Senior Assistant Customer Service is the first point of contact with our customer and sets the tone for their WestRock experience. The Senior Assistant Customer Service maintains an ongoing relationship with multiple customers and sales teams across one or multiple plants, utilizing a diverse knowledge of products, production planning, logistics, and inventory management.
Major Job Responsibilities:
Business Excellence
Facilitates quotes and provides pricing.
Create new item specifications/projects.
Manage accounts through
processing incoming orders, and/or inquiries, by scheduling demand on machines, and managing orders to ensure customer's delivery requirements are met.
Proactively track order activity, inventory levels, and alert appropriate staff/customers of any potential issues
Handle outside purchases for services and materials required for the manufacturing of customer projects.
Produce reports and share data with customers.
Generate customer issues and support the Quality Manager to obtain information, research, and troubleshoot quality issues.
People and Culture
Empowered to develop yourself through a culture of training to give you the tools to accomplish your best work and satisfy the customer and business partners.
Collaborate and partner with appropriate business owners to ensure customer experience is delivered.
Serve as a connection between customers, sales team, credit analyst, and collections to ensure responsiveness and customer satisfaction.
Pre-Pricing Specialist to build customer specifications/projects and review with production team to ensure efficient production.
Planning, production, and shipping teams to review schedules and backlogs to ensure on time delivery.
Quality Manager to resolve routine customer quality issues.
Plant Leadership to align with company goals and initiatives.
Critical Skills / Capabilities:
Attention to Detail:
Follow established processes and procedures to ensure accuracy of work (Do it right the first time)
Customer-Oriented:
Ability to operate with customers' best interests in mind; Demonstrates importance for satisfying external and/or internal customers; Efficiently communicates with customers to ensure alignment and satisfaction.
Communication:
Proactive, prompt, and respectful correspondences; essential listening skills with ability to accurately problem solve
Collaboration:
Works effectively with others to complete a task or achieve a common objective; ability to cooperate in team relationships to foster enthusiasm and maintain mutual trust, candor, and respect for others
Problem-Solving:
Identifies and analyzes problems; weighs relevance and accuracy of information; generates and evaluates alternative solutions; makes recommendations; demonstrates problem solving skills by using a logical, systematic, or sequential approach; s
uggest alternative products or services to meet customer needs when appropriate. Problems are typically of a routine nature but may at times require discernment. Defers overly complex issues to higher levels.
Growth and Results Oriented:
Demonstrates an interest, willingness, and drive to learn new things; seeks to understand concepts, processes, and ideas within area of functional expertise; naturally inquisitive; sets meaningful goals for personal work productivity.
Organizational Skills:
Planning, monitoring, and prioritizing tasks to ensure achievement of desired results; establishes a systematic course of action to accomplish objectives through multi-tasking and ability to forward-think.
Time Management:
Ability to structure time to meet customer demands; demonstrate flexibility to balance your schedule, tasks, and responsibilities to complete things on time.
Technical Skills:
Microsoft Office – Outlook, Teams, Excel, Word, PowerPoint
System Experience (e.g., AS/400, Kiwiplan ESP/PCS/ULT/TSS, HRMS, Amtech, Sage, JD Edwards, Salesforce, EDI, Customer Portals)
Other Qualifications:
To perform the duties of the job, this role requires:
Frequently using fingers to type with two hands.
Frequently reaching by extending fingers on one hand
Frequently reaching by extending one or two arms
Frequently using fingers to grasp with one or two hands.
Frequently using fingers to pinch with one or two hands.
Occasionally exerting force by pulling up to 10 lbs. of weight.
Occasionally exerting force by pushing up to 10 lbs. of weight.
Occasionally exerting force by lifting up to 10 lbs. of weight.
The spoken exchange of ideas to be performed loudly 50-75% of the time.
The spoken exchange of ideas to be performed quickly 50-75% of the time.
The safe and accurate preparation and analyzing of data and figures, monitoring of a computer terminal, or inspection of small defects or parts.
The ability to quickly interpret and process large quantities of information verbally and through written communications.
Work Environment:
Constantly works indoors, in an environment that is climate controlled.
The role is frequently sedentary, which entails sitting or being stationary.
Occasionally stands or walks for 1-2 hours at a time.
Noisy work environment; maintain strict adherence to safety rules and regulations.
Full time-Onsite
Experience:
Required: Basic Knowledge of operational procedure and tools.
Required: Customer service or related work experience in manufacturing environment or other industries
Preferred: 1-3 years of manufacturing industry experience
Education:
Required: High School diploma or G.E.D.
Preferred: Associate/bachelor’s degree
The salary range for this position is $45,000 to $52,000, depending on your role, level, and location. The benefits for this role may include short-term bonus incentive, health, dental and vision insurance, flexible spending accounts or health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and paid sick leave as required by applicable state/local law, 10 days of paid vacation, and 11 days of paid holidays, subject to annual change. 8080 North Point Blvd, Winston-Salem, NC 27106
Job Title: Senior Electronic Technician
Position Type: Full-Time
Pay: $42.43/hr
Location: On-site – Winston-Salem, NC
Department: Maintenance / Engineering
Reports To: Maintenance Supervisor or Engineering Manager
About Smurfit WestRock
At Smurfit WestRock, we are a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. Our Winston-Salem facility is a key part of our commitment to innovation, quality, and environmental responsibility. We believe in empowering our employees and fostering a culture of safety, integrity, and continuous improvement.
Position Summary
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior Electronic Technician to join our maintenance and engineering team. This role is responsible for troubleshooting, repairing, and maintaining complex electrical and electronic systems in a fast-paced manufacturing environment. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in industrial electronics, PLCs, and automation systems.
Key Responsibilities
Diagnose and repair electrical and electronic equipment, including PLCs, HMIs, drives, sensors, and control systems.
Perform preventive and predictive maintenance on electrical systems and components.
Collaborate with engineering and production teams to improve equipment reliability and efficiency.
Read and interpret electrical schematics, blueprints, and technical manuals.
Install, configure, and calibrate instrumentation and control devices.
Maintain accurate maintenance records and documentation.
Ensure compliance with safety standards and company policies.
Qualifications
Associate degree or technical certification in Electronics, Electrical Engineering Technology, or related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in an industrial or manufacturing environment.
Proficiency in troubleshooting PLCs (Allen-Bradley, Siemens, etc.) and automation systems.
Strong understanding of electrical codes, safety practices, and lockout/tagout procedures.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a 24/7 operation.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
Why Join Us?
Competitive salary and benefits package
Opportunities for professional growth and advancement
Supportive and inclusive work environment
Commitment to sustainability and innovation

Successful completion of a criminal background check and pre-employment physical and drug screen.

The opportunity:
The site L&D leader will partner with the Division & Regional Learning and Development Team and with operations leadership to support implementation and accountability to the L&D Framework, Systems and Tools across their site. The role is responsible for ensuring that their site drives common learning systems, processes and training standards through site identified team members that support training delivery locally, to enable our sites to be able to have world class learning experiences.  The site L&D leader is the key partner for the site leadership team to ensure they are able to effectively deploy our common processes, Orientation, Onboarding, Job Certification and Development processes that enable their strategies.  This team member will work closely with their site leadership to enable team members to support the day-to-day management of manufacturing training. They will do this through a strong network of trainers and building their capability to ensure they can support delivery of the day-to-day learning processes needed within manufacturing.  They will be the lead admin for the LMS System and support other admins/ trainers that help manage the system processes day to day.
How you will impact Smurfit Westrock:
Key partner working with the Divisional L&D Leader, site HR Manager and site General Manager to prioritize core learning priorities across their space
Responsible to connect with and support local site leadership teams and trainers to implement and continuously improve site training processes (e.g., Orientation, Onboarding, Job Certification, Development Processes), including system/process accountability and reporting
Responsible to partner with local operations team/ trainers to build out and implement on the job training for critical roles
Responsible to support content/ learning solution creation with trainers/ SME’s, using the ADDIE model and consideration for emerging technology
Responsible to administer the Cornerstone Learning Management System (LMS) – Able to build, track and assign training
Responsible to ensure training documentation is stored, linked, and utilized as a part of the training process in a systemic way
Responsible to implement local trainer onboarding/ development process to ensure highly effective trainers are utilized during the learning & development process
Key partner to local trainers, ensuring that safety/ quality leaders have all required compliance trainings tracked and refreshed as needed
Key owners to ensure orientation and onboarding processes are effective & the employee experience is measured and on target
Able to manage and balance multiple competing priorities
Additional duties as assigned
As a relationship builder, connector, and key support resource to local site leadership teams, trainers, and operations team members – fostering a world class learning and development experience & culture
Improve local trainer/ team performance through skill gap closure and skill development - increasing skills and time to certification
Key L&D system/ framework owner ensuring we support and enable local trainers, to identify skill gaps and forecast future skill needs, prior to losing talent – all while continuously improving and driving performance efficiencies
Cost eliminator across roles, saving us unnecessary risk and leveraging synergies
What you need to succeed:
Critical Skills/Capabilities:
Growth and Results Oriented:
Results oriented person that looks for constant ways to improve
Innovation:
Able to support implementation of new processes and new learning technologies to drive training into the flow of work
Interpersonal Skills:
Possess keen awareness and understanding of the importance of strong interpersonal skills in communicating, achieving OKR’s and leading people or teams (self-awareness)
Accountability:
Holds self and others responsible for actions and results
Influence:
Able to partner and build relationships to influence teams to work together, share best practice and develop and drive effective training for operations teams

Uses strong problem-solving skills and supporting information to arrive at optimal decisions in an appropriated timeframe; knows when to decide and/or when to seek additional input, and drive for consensus
Communication:
willingness to work on the floor and in a heavy manufacturing world to ensure we can document and teach critical work processes
Technical Skills:
Learning & Development Experience (e.g., ADDIE Design, L&D Technology/ Design Tools, Facilitation, On-the-job training, Implementing and Measuring L&D Systems/ Frameworks/ Processes):  3-5 years
Prefer industry knowledge, or experience in manufacturing
Knowledge of Learning Management Systems
ATD Instructional Design Learning Cert and/ or Other Learning/ HR cert (preferred)
Bachelor’s Degree Required – Focus Areas Preferred…Human Resources, Teaching, Learning & Development, Adult Learning, Org Development, Instructional Design, Continuous Improvement
Microsoft Office – Teams, Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Forms

Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
The opportunity:
We are seeking an experienced and strategic Procurement Manager to join our team. As the Manager, Procurement, you will be responsible for sourcing, managing, and optimizing contract manufacturing partners. This role will focus on developing category strategies, optimizing costs, and ensuring contract manufacturers meet performance, quality, and compliance expectations. Additionally, you will drive process standardization, continuous process improvement, and cost savings, across the enterprise.
How you will impact Smurfit Westrock:
Develop and execute category strategies for contract manufacturing, aligned with overall procurement and business objectives
Lead sourcing events (RFPs, RFQs), supplier selection, negotiations, and contract management to ensure cost savings, quality and timely delivery
Manage end-to-end supplier relationships, including performance management, risk assessments, quality, service levels, and continuous improvement initiatives
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Sales, Operations, Planning, and R&D to align supply capabilities with business needs
Monitor market trends and benchmarking to identify trends, opportunities and supply chain risks to mitigate potential disruptions
Drive the standardization of procurement processes through stakeholder engagement and alignment across all business segments to ensure we optimize our purchasing power and create transactional efficiency.
What you need to succeed:
Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Business, or related field (MBA or Master’s degree preferred)
Minimum 5 years of procurement or category management experience with exposure to contract manufacturing or outsourced operations in a fast-paced, manufacturing environment
Experience negotiating manufacturing services agreements and managing long-term supplier partnerships with key suppliers
Strong negotiation, contract management and supplier relationship management skills
Ability to easily build relationships with stakeholders and resolve potential conflicts
Strong understanding of manufacturing cost drivers and operational KPIs
Ability to work across multiple teams and lead through influence.

Description & Requirements
Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
Career Opportunity:
The Quality Manager role focuses on compliance, customers, and continuous improvement activities to create a total quality culture and reduce quality costs in line with best practice procedures. You will support introduction of new equipment on site and validation processes to meet safety and customer expectations. Additionally, you will promote a total quality philosophy at all levels developing a culture of right first time and continuous improvement.
How you will impact Smurfit Westrock:
Contribute ideas and participate in ongoing business improvement initiatives to reduce overall operating costs, improve margin, and provide input into the strategy and operations of the site
Establish and develop professional working relationships with customers, providing a technical service and reference point as required to support the company’s products and reputation as a quality supplier
Lead and support meetings as required and provide information and analysis as required to support the business in understanding KPI’s and decision making
Review the quality system as appropriate to ensure full compliance with customer and company best practice guidelines and maximize effectiveness of production contributing to consistent operational performance and standards whilst ensuring conformance to the relevant accreditation standards for the site and customers
Provide authoritative guidance and advice on all aspects of quality to the site management team and employees; train and coach employees improving knowledge and skills in quality improvement
Recruit, develop, motivate, and manage a Quality team (QA/QC) that optimizes quality operations and is flexible in the support it offers the business, meeting current and future needs
Manage the customer complaint procedure, facilitate the investigation of quality problems, faults, and non-conformances with production teams; manage corrective and preventative problems to ensure quality standards are maintained.  Initiate and control robust investigations to provide corrective and preventive actions (CAPA) and support the complaints handling process and participate in implementing improvement actions to prevent re-occurring issues.
Facilitate customer facing activities and communications including customer visits, responses, and preparation of information whilst leading site audit activities (external body, internal and customer)
Lead quality initiatives and focus groups to support knowledge and understanding of all operatives and grow awareness of quality issues to improve quality
Promote a total quality philosophy at all levels developing a culture of right first time and continuous improvement
Develop an Integrated Quality Management System including quality, environment and health and safety
Continually monitor and review current working practices and make the best use of resources to improve organizational results
What you need to succeed:
3- 5 years’ experience in a Quality Leadership role in a manufacturing environment
Bachelor’s Degree is preferred, ASQ certification is a plus
Printing and / or Packaging industry experience is preferred
Ability to inspire a team with a clear vision and purpose
Ability to teach operational skills to others and mentor/coach accordingly
Customer-focused
Demonstrable experience of leading change and implementing continuous improvement processes.
Demonstrable experience of validating new equipment and processes
Knowledge of ISO and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP)
Root cause analysis and problem-solving, focus on continuous improvement, Lean Six Sigma a plus
Skilled in information handling, analysis, and presentation
Proficient in Microsoft Office and QMS systems
What We Offer:
Corporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability and excellence
Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities
An attractive salary reflecting skills, competencies and potential
A generous benefits package starting on your first day of employment, including medical, dental, vision, disability, life insurance, 401k match, annual 401k bonus, paid time off
A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work.

Hands-on training with industry-standard tools, software, and equipment

The opportunity to grow within a global leader in the paper and packaging industry

SC Florence

Description & Requirements
Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
E&I Maintenance Planner - Florence, SC
The opportunity:
The Electrical Maintenance Planner provides for the effective use of personnel, materials, and machine downtime to maintain production equipment availability and performance at satisfactory levels through the planning, scheduling, coordinating, and reporting of repair activities.  Planners report directly to the Planning Superintendent.
How you will impact Smurfit Westrock:
Take responsibility for the initial screening of incoming work orders, scope identification, determination of basic job requirements and planning requirements.
Prepare job packages for craftsmen with detailed information to facilitate efficient and safe work implementation.
Preview, audit, and review repairs under work order process.
Ensure appropriate documentation is completed at job completion.
Plan and schedule unit outages using Microsoft Project.
Take leadership role in organizing and reviewing outage work into one integrated schedule.
Specify and orders parts and materials needed for planned repair work.
Develop scopes of work, solicit bids, contract and coordinates work as needed.
Operate within WestRock’s planning systems, with a mindset of continuous improvement.
Keeps equipment bill of materials current in CMMS.
Manage work order backlog.
Interface with all operating departments.
Support and foster safety and environmental compliance.
What you need to succeed:
High School Diploma or equivalent, Bachelor’s degree is preferred
5-10 years of experience in Pulp and Paper industry is preferred
Knowledge of Power Boilers, Pulping Chemical Recovery Processes and Equipment, Turbine Generation Operation, and Electrical and Steam distribution systems is preferred
Supervisory or management experience is preferred
Experience in the following areas:
Power distribution systems
Process instrumentation systems
Distributed control systems
Programmable logic controllers
Coordinated drive systems
Variable speed A.C. and D.C. drives
Low and medium voltage motor control centers
Competencies:
Safety
– Exhibits strong competencies in Safety Mindset and has a thorough understanding of safety policies and procedures.
Ability to Execute –
Targets and achieves results, sets and accomplishes challenging goals, prioritizes and manages tasks effectively, maintains an organized system to monitor progress, overcomes obstacles, accepts accountability, sets standards and responsibilities.
Champion of & Adaptor to Change –
Drives for continuous improvement while managing expectations and results.  Able to quickly adapt to changing circumstances and accelerates the change within themselves, their work group, or the organization; challenges the status quo and creatively identifies opportunities for improvement.  Demonstrates a constant commitment to do things better.
Customer Focused –
Understands and works to meet customer requirements.  Listens to and responds to customer’s needs; builds relationships with and gains trust of customer by always meeting commitments.
Decision Making/Judgment –
Recognizes problems and responds by systematically gathering information and weighing options.  Able to sort through complex issues, seeks input from others and addresses root cause of issues.  Makes timely and accurate decisions.  Uses consensus when possible and clearly communicates decisions to others.
Initiative –
Tackles problems and takes independent action.  Seeks out new responsibilities, acts on opportunities, generates new ideas, practices self-development, and demonstrates a bias for action without being prompted.
Problem Solving/Analysis –
Breaks down problems into smaller components, understands underlying issues.   Can simplify and process complex issues and information, understands the difference between critical details and unimportant facts, can analyze data/information and draw accurate conclusions.
Influence & Persuasion –
Able to exhibit a ‘can-do’ approach and inspire associates to excel, uses competition to encourage others, develops performance standards and confronts negative attitudes.  Develops a team spirit and uses tact when expressing ideas or opinions.  Presents new ideas to authority figures and adapts presentations to suit a particular audience.  Responds to objections successfully.
Quality –
Attentive to detail and accuracy; is committed to excellence.  Continuously looks for improvements, seeks opportunities to increase effectiveness and efficiency.
Integrity –
Able to be tactful, maintain confidences, and foster an ethical work environment.  Prevents inappropriate behavior by coworkers, give proper credit to others and handles all situations honestly.
Communication –
Able to clearly present information through spoken or written word; read and interpret complex information; talks with employees, customers, and supplies, and has strong listening skills.
What we offer:
Corporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability and excellence
Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities
An attractive salary reflecting skills, competencies and potential
A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work.
WestRock Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating and maintaining a diverse workforce: Minorities/Females/ Disabled/Veterans.

This entry-level position consists of the following duties that are essential to the operation of a corrugated box plant. A Preset Operator is normally the third team member assigned to a machine in the Production Department. Some of the duties of this position include, but are not limited to: ensuring that all tooling for the machine is on hand, assisting the machine operator and assistant operator with setups and jam-ups, ensuring that the area surrounding the machine is kept clean of debris and spills, and being available to relieve team members when they go out on lunch or breaks. This position requires standing, walking, lifting, bending, and crouching.
* The pay for this position is $24.56/hour.
* Support the operation of a high-paced packaging manufacturing facility
* Opportunity for development and growth in manufacturing

* able to lift, push, or pull 50 pounds on a routine basis

* Ability to read a tape measure and apply basic math and computer skills
* Must pass a background check, pre-employment drug screen, and physical
Ideal Applicant:
* Works in a safe manner, complies with all safety rules
* Has experience working in a fast-paced manufacturing environment (corrugated industry a plus, but not required)
* Embraces the WestRock culture, based on values of integrity, respect, accountability, and excellence - establishing a foundation for our employees to win together
* Flexible to work 1st, 2nd, or 3rd shifts - daily overtime, weekend work
* Open to learning
* Willing to follow work processes
* Possesses a desire to advance within the facility
* Maintains a clean and organized workspace
The salary range for this position $25.42
per hour, depending on your role, level, and location. Description & Requirements
Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
The opportunity:
We are seeking an experienced and strategic Procurement Manager to join our team. As the Manager, Procurement, you will be responsible for sourcing, managing, and optimizing contract manufacturing partners. This role will focus on developing category strategies, optimizing costs, and ensuring contract manufacturers meet performance, quality, and compliance expectations. Additionally, you will drive process standardization, continuous process improvement, and cost savings, across the enterprise.
How you will impact Smurfit Westrock:
Develop and execute category strategies for contract manufacturing, aligned with overall procurement and business objectives
Lead sourcing events (RFPs, RFQs), supplier selection, negotiations, and contract management to ensure cost savings, quality and timely delivery
Manage end-to-end supplier relationships, including performance management, risk assessments, quality, service levels, and continuous improvement initiatives
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Sales, Operations, Planning, and R&D to align supply capabilities with business needs
Monitor market trends and benchmarking to identify trends, opportunities and supply chain risks to mitigate potential disruptions
Drive the standardization of procurement processes through stakeholder engagement and alignment across all business segments to ensure we optimize our purchasing power and create transactional efficiency.
What you need to succeed:
Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Business, or related field (MBA or Master’s degree preferred)
Minimum 5 years of procurement or category management experience with exposure to contract manufacturing or outsourced operations in a fast-paced, manufacturing environment
Experience negotiating manufacturing services agreements and managing long-term supplier partnerships with key suppliers
Strong negotiation, contract management and supplier relationship management skills
Ability to easily build relationships with stakeholders and resolve potential conflicts
Strong understanding of manufacturing cost drivers and operational KPIs
Ability to work across multiple teams and lead through influence.

At Smurfit Westrock we offer a long-term career with a clear path of advancement in a thriving, dynamic environment. Join us and be a part of a world-class team that’s shaping the future of packaging.
The Opportunity:
The Quality Manager will ensure quality standards are met and maintained by understanding, implementing, and enforcing Customer, Regulatory, and Smurfit Westrock processes, policies, and procedures. You will be accountable for internal and external quality complaint resolution, execution of audits, and ensuring efficient and smooth operations within the production facility.
This position is located at the Wakefield, MA Corrugated Container facility.
How You Will Impact Smurfit Westrock:
Review, approve, and execute facility and corporate standard operating procedures for site implementation
Coordinate and execute internal, customer, supplier, subcontractor, and regulatory audits
Monitor and ensure compliance with current policies, procedures, regulatory requirements, and customer requirements
Coordinate and execute investigation of detected risks or failures, complaints, and corrective/preventative actions
Work closely with production managers to maximize product quality and reliability and minimize cost
Track, analyze, and lead initiatives for all internal quality and customer complaint issues
Determine, document, and approve site-specific or one-time occurrences such as protocols (reworks, validations, etc.), deviations (planned or unplanned), waivers, or releases for materials and products as required
Leverage enterprise technology to analyze quality complaints, track corrective and preventive actions, and use data to isolate and track defective parts per million, over shipments, and resolve issues related to rejected products when applicable
Execute facility improvement initiatives as determined from performance data
Lead team of quality technicians and Safe Quality Foods (SQF) readiness resources, ensuring that processes are efficient, and work is appropriately prioritized
Provide tools and training for quality management and quality improvement to the facility staff
What You Need to Succeed:
High School diploma, or G.E.D – Required
5+ years of work-related manufacturing experience.
3+ years of experience in a production supervisory role.
Demonstrate strong communication and interpersonal skills to engage and inspire others to comply with quality standards.
Proven track record of problem-solving.
Solid understanding of and experience in quality assurance, delivery excellence, data analysis and development of business insights
Thorough knowledge of quality standards and methodologies.
Ability to learn proprietary software programs and leverage enterprise complaint management software
Professional training and quality certifications courses (e.g. Six Sigma, ISO Certification) are preferred
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by state or federal law.
The salary range for this position is $83,250.00 - $138,750.00, depending on your role, level, and location. The range listed is also the expected pay for roles in Illinois and Colorado. The benefits for this role include short-term bonus incentive, health, dental and vision insurance, flexible spending accounts or health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and paid sick leave as required by applicable state/local law, 10 days of paid vacation, and 11 days of paid holidays, subject to annual change. Roanoke Rapids, NC Mill
Are you a hands-on leader with a passion for safety, reliability, and technical excellence? Join our team as an

, where you’ll lead a skilled group of 10–15 Electrical & Instrumentation technicians and play a critical role in maintaining and improving mill operations.
What You’ll Do
Lead and Develop Your Team:
Ensure safety compliance, provide training, assign work, and foster a culture of accountability and continuous improvement.
Drive Operational Excellence:
Act as the primary resource for technical troubleshooting and problem-solving on electrical and instrumentation systems.

Education:
Bachelors or Associate’s degree in Electrical Engineering preferred.

Leadership Skills:
Excellent organizational, analytical, and communication abilities to manage teams and collaborate with multiple stakeholders.
Why Join Us?
At Smurfit WestRock, you’ll have the opportunity to make a real impact on mill performance, safety, and reliability while growing your leadership and technical skills in a supportive environment.

Intermediate Industrial Electricians perform a variety of maintenance related tasks in connection with the maintenance department to improve the reliability and up-time of equipment used in the pulp and paper manufacturing process. Service and maintain existing electrical equipment, including plant lighting and receptacle circuits, motors, starters, relays, push buttons, limit switches, special control switches, timers, counters, motor control centers, control panels and transformers, as well as the test equipment needed to do this servicing.

Troubleshooting industrial electrical equipment using the necessary test equipment like voltmeters, ammeters, ohmmeters, and oscilloscopes.

Successful completion of a formal or vocational education program within the last three years or have worked in an industrial manufacturing environment as a sub journeyman Electrician or E&I Technician 2 out of the last 5 years.
Basic knowledge and experience in computer usage.

Stevenson is centrally located between Chattanooga, Tennessee and Huntsville, Alabama. This is a unionized facility with approximately 400 employees. Provide Leadership and coaching to rotating shift operational crews in the Paper Machine and Shipping Department

Provides the guidance and leadership to maintain the housekeeping of the departments

or

Excellent problem solving and analytical skills and the ability to make decisions based on alarm or upset process conditions that may be critical in preventing major breakdowns.

Previous work experience in a unionized location is preferred
Previous supervisory experience is preferred
Working knowledge in the majority of these programs: Outlook Email, Acrobat Reader, Microsoft Office to include Word, and Excel, EPAM, PI and the ability to learn new applications.
Analytical and Decision-making skills

Smurfit Westrock’s West Point Mill is looking to find committed, hardworking individuals to fill current openings as
Electrical Maintenance Techs
at our Papermill in West Point, VA.  We offer a competitive wage ranging from $33.04 to $44.30 and a full benefits package.
We are looking for candidates with experience and a thorough knowledge of a diverse range of Electrical, Power Distribution, motor control, troubleshooting, and repair.  Some of the equipment is as follows.
Programmable logic controllers.
Variable speed drives.
Various industrial communication protocols.
Motor control circuits.
Electrical power distribution equipment such as feeder breakers, switches, transformers, and associated relays.
AC induction motors, DC motors, AC synchronous motors and controls.
The responsibilities of the Electrical Journeyman will include but not limited to the following:
Industrial Electrical and Instrumentation plant maintenance to include preventative maintenance tasks and troubleshooting plant equipment.
The ability to read and understand electrical schematics, loop sheets, process and instrumentation diagrams, and equipment manuals.
The ability to understand and troubleshoot various forms of control logic, such as ladder logic, and function block diagrams.
The ability to use and understand various types of test equipment such as calibration equipment, digital multi-meters, megohmmeters, etc.
Must possess a working knowledge of electrical safety precautions and procedures for example, LOTO, NFPA-70E.
Responsible for troubleshooting and repair of all electrical and control equipment throughout the mill.
Use of data historian software.
The Ability to work rotating shifts (southern swing)
Perform duties as part of the Incident Response Team and participate as a fire brigade member.
What you need to succeed:
Experience with Allen Bradley PLCs, Honeywell and Valmet DCS, Allen Bradely Powerflex Drives, and/or GE DC Drives preferred.
Pass written testing requirements.
Available to work overtime as required.
Must possess a strong desire and willingness to learn the equipment.
Decision making and troubleshooting abilities
Good communication and computer skills.
Must be highly motivated, conscientious, and a good team player with a positive attitude.
Must be able to work safely.
Minimum qualifications to be considered for this job:
High School or GED plus Virginia Career Readiness Certificate,
and at least one of the below credentials
2 Year technical Degree or associate’s degree
5+ years industrial electrical experience
Licensed Journeyman or Master Electrician
Appropriate Military Technical Training
Certificate of Apprenticeship
Compensation & Career Growth
We offer a clear, structured path for career advancement with competitive pay:
•Class 1 Helper: $33.05/hour. Promotion to Class C possible within 9-13 months based on performance.
•Class C: $35.11/hour. Eligible for Class B after 6 months.
•Class B: $37.10/hour. Promotion to Class A after 12 months.
•Class A: $39.71/hour. Final step to Class AAA ($42.80/hour) based on tenure and qualifications.
Total Progression Time: 2.25-2.5 years (27-31 months) from Class 1 Helper to Class A.
Grow your career and earnings with us!

General Information
Job ID
