Description & Requirements
Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
Job Summary:
The Technical Trainer assists with training processes locally. The role reports into the site Production Manager and dotted lines into Operations Learning & Development, to ensure training is completed for Operator/ Craft Job Certification. The role will be a key contact/ trainer for team members and be responsible for teammate assessments regarding machine skills – providing feedback, machine certification responsibility, and conducting assessments related to line of progression movements.
Major Job Responsibilities:
Completes daily technical training on the floor to assist with the Certification of team members in their roles
Partners with OPS L&D leader to support New Hire Orientation/ On Boarding Training, as needed
Assists with tracking, evaluating, and measuring training locally using the company’s Dept. Training
Standards & Learning System tools
Supports site specific technical learning solution creation (SOP’s, Guided Workflows, Technical Learning
Aids - to assist with training)
Develops, builds, and maintains relationships with trainees & leaders in their role
Participates in new teammate hiring process – assesses candidates’ skills (general and/ or machine,
Involved in interview process to assess industrial experience, and provides perspective on hiring decisions)
Conduct training on all shifts
Influences others to be safety-minded
Team members will be certified through a Train the Trainer process, support managing day-to-day Certification Processes & will be supported by Ops L&D with training tools & general knowledge content
Additional duties as assigned
How you will impact WestRock:
Improve local team performance through increasing skills and time to certification processes
Cost eliminator driving training efficiencies across roles, saving us unnecessary risk, and reducing the time allotted for training – a continuous improvement mindset
What you need to succeed:
Critical Skills/ Capabilities:
Growth and Results Oriented:
Results oriented person that looks for constant ways to improve
Innovation:
Able to support implementation of new processes and new learning technologies to drive training into the flow of work
Interpersonal Skills:
Possess keen awareness and understanding of the importance of strong interpersonal skills in communicating, achieving OKR’s and leading people or teams (self-awareness)
Accountability:
Holds self and others responsible for actions and results
Influence:
Able to partner and build relationships to influence teams to work together, share best practices and develop and drive effective training for operations teams
Decision Making:
Uses strong problem-solving skills and supporting information to arrive at optimal decisions in an appropriate timeframe; knows when to decide and/ or when to seek additional input, and drive for consensus
Communication:
Willingness to work on the floor, with all shifts, in a heavy manufacturing world, to ensure we can document and teach critical work processes
Quality:
Actively work to ensure quality is ensured while minimizing waste
Technical Skills:
1 – 3 years’ experience conducting/ leading training, including On-The-Job training, or similar, in a manufacturing environment preferred
2 – 4 years’ experience in a manufacturing environment preferred
Knowledge of Learning Management Systems preferred
Microsoft Office Experience Preferred– Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Forms
Others Qualification:
Facilitation/ Presentation Skills
Influencing
Partnering
Problem Solving/ Continuous Improvement
Professionalism
What we offer:
C
orporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability, and excellence
Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities
An attractive wage, reflecting skills, competencies, and potential
A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of our daily work

description_text:
General Information
Job ID
ATR57751
Posting Job Title
Coordinator, Product Planning
Locations
NC Mebane
Employment Type
Full Time
Date Posted
23-Jan-2026
Relocation Support
No
Description & Requirements
Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
Full Time - Mebane, NC
Project Manager
Job Summary:
The role of a Project Manager is to develop, plan, and manage customer projects internally as it relates to adherence and secondary packaging for this unique specialty/converting operation. Achieve high customer satisfaction effectively through and with operations, customer service, sales, and the customer.
Major Job Responsibilities:
Business Excellence
Manage and lead new product introduction and launches from conception to delivery, including order entry, supply chain and production to ensure optimum solution and level of customer focus achieved.
Responsibility for delivering excellent customer service in both the development phase of a project and production phase of the manufacturing process. This is designed to deliver and facilitate growth in the adherence and secondary packaging market.
Drive customers generated projects. Responsible for coordinating activities of the project team, identifying appropriate resources, and developing schedules to ensure timely completion of projects.
Manage and develop documentation for internal equipment, material, and process trials.
Run and compile reports from ERP system (EFI Radius and PSA) for management review.
Develop job aids, process maps and Gantt charts for critical processes and projects to train department leads on new processes.
Work closely with scheduling and planning teams and help manage and review production capacity and constraints.
Liaison between the plant, sales, customer service, and customers on all customer related projects and new product introductions (NPI) and approvals.
Host and lead weekly meetings with customers and interplant teams as per the project requirements.
Develop technical competency to support customer and sales enquiries.
Build technical reports using Microsoft (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) tools for team review.
Support line trials and troubleshoot issues internally and at customer sites.
Lead and assist with site transfer/outsource work to other plants/third party vendors or work coming in from other plants.
Support pricing and directly engage Customer Service Representatives (CSR’s) in new product introduction/development.
Key point of contact at the site for customer visits.
Key point of contact for commercial organization for samples and information requests.
Provide expertise and technical support on ERP system modules and VWT as needed.
Critical Skills / Capabilities:
Problem-Solving:
Identifies and analyzes problems; weighs relevance and accuracy of information; generates and evaluates alternative solutions; makes recommendations; demonstrates tackling a problem by using a logical, systematic, or sequential approach.
Collaboration:
Works effectively with others to complete a task or achieve a common objective; ability to cooperate in both interpersonal and team relationships to foster enthusiasm and maintain mutual trust, candor, and respect for others. Works through conflict constructively.
Accountability:
Holds self and others responsible for actions and result.
Adaptability:
Demonstrates agility, flexibility, and a willingness to modify one’s approach to achieve desired results; responds quickly to changing demands, processes, and updated information.
Detailed-Oriented:
Has an eye for recognizing errors or differences; plans and completes work with thoroughness, giving attention to specific information and individual details, conditions, necessary record keeping, and elements of that work.
Qualifications/Requirements:
To perform the duties of the job, this role requires:
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills – verbal, written, electronic.
Performa/Handle multiple tasks in a high energy environment without losing sight of long and short term company objectives.
Be able to find solutions to problems by being creative, adaptable, flexible, and innovative
Willing to travel to customer/vendor locations.
General knowledge of associated machinery and processing.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Project).
Other technical tools such as VISIO, MiniTab, and AutoCad are preferred, not required.
Demonstrate good time management and methodical approach to organization and project planning.
Be able to work well with others and collaborate with different departments.
Experience:
Preferred: 2+ years of manufacturing experience in a fast-paced work environment
Education:
Required: Bachelor’s Degree in technical discipline (i.e engineering) or equivalent experience
Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by state or federal law.

Description & Requirements
Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
Career Opportunity:
Join Smurfit Westrock as a Production Supervisor on Seond Shift with opportunities to advance and learn alongside accomplished leaders in the industry. As a Production Supervisor you will be responsible for the safe and efficient operations of converting production. In this role you will communicate performance expectations to shift workers, ensure production targets and metrics are met to achieve production demands, supervise machine productivity and quality, and manage personnel daily. You will work in a collaborative work environment and coordinate production operations and maintain effective quality procedures and safety regulations. You will be trained, mentored, and developed to succeed and further your career.
How you will impact Smurfit Westrock:
Manage the day-to-day operations of the shift and ensure that all company standards and customer commitments (safety, quality, production, cost, on-time delivery) are met
Be a champion for change, drive results to bring the facility from Good to Great
Supervise daily production activities, including oversight of team members, and monitor performance levels of each team member
Lead and coach employees to meet the safety, quality, production, and all other key performance indicators of a fast-paced work team
Enforce plant safety regulations and encourage employees to become safety conscious
Build relationships with internal departments to produce a superior product, resulting in happy customers
Help build a world-class team, training your successor as you advance your WestRock career
Ensure all company safety policies and safe work practices are followed to ensure safety of self and others
Monitor and participate in Daily Management Systems (DMS) to track progress against production goals and enable performance excellence
Sustain productivity levels by properly staffing line production and equipment to meet customer demands and align any last-minute scheduling changes
Ensure SQF/food packaging safety compliance
What you need to succeed:
2+ years of supervisory experience in a printing or paperboard / packaging manufacturing environment
High school diploma or GED is required
Ability to be an on-shift resource for printing troubleshooting problems is highly desired
Knowledge of manufacturing processes, procedures, and machinery; folding carton or food service packaging is a plus
Strong focus on Safety and Quality (SQF knowledge is a plus)
Experience in leading continuous improvement initiatives (Lean, Six Sigma, TQM)
High School Diploma or equivalent required; college degree is preferred
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, specifically Excel and Word; ability to learn new software applications
Bilingual (Spanish) is a plus
Proven successful track record in managing, motivating and building teams
What We Offer:
Corporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability and excellence
Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities
An attractive salary reflecting skills, competencies and potential
A generous benefits package starting on your first day of employment, including medical, dental, vision, disability, life insurance, 401k match, paid time off
A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work.
Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by state or federal law.

The Electrical Maintenance Technician will have complete involvement in routine or emergency maintenance as well as corrective, preventive, predictive maintenance and basic care for all electrical and mechanical equipment and their related controls.
What we offer:
Shift(s) Must be able to work a 2nd or 3rd Shift (8-hour)
Safety is #1 Priority
Health, Dental and Vision Insurance + Flexible Spending Account / Health Savings Account
Paid Time Off and Holidays
Life Insurance and Short-Term Disability
401(k) with company match, and Pension Program
Overtime Potential
Career Development Opportunities
Corporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability, and excellence.
Responsibilities:
Maintain a safe working environment by supporting, sustaining, and troubleshooting safety circuits while promoting a strong safety culture.
Maintain and up-keep machinery control panels and control systems.
Troubleshoot high- and low-voltage circuits, analog devices, VFDs, motor controls, drives, and PLC systems to determine root causes of failures.
Install, configure, and troubleshoot AC/DC drives and PLC hardware/software.
Utilize RSLogix, Studio 5000, SLC500, HMI and related drive interface software (experience is a plus).
Perform preventive maintenance on mechanical, electrical, pneumatic, and hydraulic equipment, including belts, gearboxes, chains, motors, and bearings.
Troubleshoot hydraulic and pneumatic systems and related components.
Work with steam‑generating boiler electrical controls and safety system.
Perform regular repair and maintenance activities across non-production areas such as warehouses, labs, buildings, and grounds.
Use a CMMS for work orders, documentation, and tracking daily activities and planned projects.
Requirements:
2–5 years of electro-mechanical troubleshooting experience (strong electrical focus preferred).
Operational knowledge of automated industrial machinery including drives, PLCs, VFDs, servos, relays, 3‑phase power, communication devices, and industrial control systems.
Ability to troubleshoot electrical control systems down to the component level.
Strong mechanical and electrical problem‑solving abilities.
Understanding of heavy rotating equipment, hydraulic systems, and pneumatic systems.
Ability to read and interpret electrical and mechanical drawings.
Working knowledge of motors, pumps, gearboxes, power transmission systems, and bearings.
Familiarity with sensors, limit switches, and general automation components.
Basic welding skills preferred but not required.
Computer proficiency, including Microsoft Office.
Provide knowledgeable feedback, written statements and SOP’s
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work independently in a mature and professional manner.
Flexibility to work various shifts, overtime, or extended hours as needed.
High school diploma or equivalent; technical school or military training preferred.

The Quality Manager will ensure quality standards are met and maintained by understanding, implementing, and enforcing Customer, Regulatory, and Smurfit Westrock processes, policies, and procedures. Review, approve, and execute facility and corporate standard operating procedures for site implementation

Install new and upgrade equipment as needed
Troubleshoot and repair all equipment to keep production going in a timely manner
Assist with inventory to identify parts and new parts to prevent minimum breakdown or machine downtime
Performs preventive and operational maintenance to ensure a functional and safe environment
Maintain records utilizing the computer of all work completed, time spent, and materials used

2+ years of industrial/manufacturing maintenance experience.
Have a safe work history and perform safe work habits.
Possess good written and verbal communication skills.
Be a self-starter and a team-oriented employee
Have knowledge of general machine shop equipment (welding, hydraulics, pneumatics, pipefitting, air compressors, fire protection, and automation)

PLC troubleshooting experience a plus

Smurfit Westrock is the leading provider of differentiated paper and packaging solutions to customers across the globe.  Have you ever ordered pizza that arrived hot and fresh at your doorstep, or an item online that you were excited to receive and open?  If so, there is a good chance that the cardboard box it came in was made in one of our Smurfit Westrock facilities. If you are looking for a rewarding career at a company that provides room for growth, has safety and sustainability built into its DNA, and values diversity and inclusion, then you have come to the right place.

Production Workers working in our clean manufacturing facility are the key to ensuring quality corrugated boxes are produced for our customers.
Working as a team, you are responsible for the daily production of quality corrugated products in a safe and efficient manner.  You will demonstrate attention to detail by ensuring order specs and special requirements are accurately followed and perform quality checks according to Smurfit Westrock’s production requirements.
The daily physical requirements included stair climbing, repetitive heavy lifting, squatting, pushing, pulling, lifting, moving, stacking cardboard through various machines.  Must be able to tolerate hot temperatures in the summer months.

An Employer that cares about your health and safety
Training opportunities to work on different machines.

A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety, and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work.
Benefits:

Health Care Spending Account
Short and Long Term Disability
Life Insurance
Employee Assistance Program
Employer matched RRSP up to 7%

High school diploma
Attention to detail
Ability to work well in a team environment
Basic math skills
Physically fit
Able to work shifts with a weekly rotation
Experience working in a manufacturing / warehouse environment is an asset (Training will be provided)
Forklift or Clamp Truck experience is an asset (Training can be provided)
As a global company, you will find our boxes worldwide!   Next time you get a box, turn it around and see if you can find the Smurfit Westrock stamp!

Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. Position Title:
Feeder Operator
Position Summary
Operate the mechanical sheet feeder and assist the Press Operator with press setup, repair, and maintenance to support efficient and high-quality press operations.
Essential Job Functions
• Clear machine before and after each run; remove and destroy all foreign materials.
• Empty all waste receptacles within the blue line area.
• Review job tickets and select the correct paper type and quantity; load and unload paper.
• Inspect paper for defects or damage.
• Obtain proper ink from the ink room and maintain correct ink fountain levels.
• Mix water fountain solution; set up and maintain the dampening system.
• Monitor and maintain proper water levels, pH balance, and conductivity readings.
• Set up and operate the mechanical press feeder.
• Assist the Press Operator with mounting plates, blankets, and packing.
• Move printed and unprinted stock as required.
• Perform routine adjustments during press runs.
• Complete housekeeping duties; maintain adequate supplies of chemicals and clean rags.
• Keep the press area clean and orderly at all times.
• Complete all ISO forms and quality checks accurately and on time.
• Mark printed sheets for coating knockouts and verify against mylar.
• Perform all duties in compliance with federal, state, local, and company safety regulations.
• Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
• Ability to read and interpret safety rules, operating instructions, and procedure manuals.
• Ability to pass a basic reading test.
• Ability to perform basic arithmetic (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division).
• Ability to meet or pass mechanical aptitude testing or demonstrate aptitude through prior experience.
• Ability to pass color vision and color hue tests.
• Ability to obtain forklift certification.
• Reliable attendance required.

The Opportunity:
The Covington mill is North America’s largest bleached paperboard mill. It began production in 1899 and has been in continuous operation since that time. Leadership has focused on continually improving and growing the business. Year after year Covington continues to deliver unprecedented safety, reliability, production, and financial results. The Covington site is ideally located due to its fiber supply, low-cost energy, and access to major user markets for products. The Covington mill has three paperboard machines that produce high-quality coated bleached board products used for multiple packaging applications (pharmaceutical, cosmetic, electronics, tobacco, and food products), as well as commercial printing applications (greeting cards, lottery tickets, business cards, direct mail, large format signage, etc.).
As an Entry-Level Process Engineer, you would provide technical services in monitoring,
investigating,
evaluating, and making
recommendation
s for improving quality, quantity, and cost of the various manufacturing processes in paperboard production. You will join our rotational team for your first year. During that year, you will rotate through approximately three departments, spending four months in each, learning the different processes. Ideally, at the end of your first year, you will be placed in a department permanently.
How you will impact Smurfit Westrock:
• Provide management with information on quality and operating parameters to assist in process control, budgeting, and detection of trends.
• Participate on process improvement teams to identify problems, evaluate solutions, make
recommendation
s, and assist in implementing approved changes to improve quality, cost, and/or throughput.
• Complete projects and development activities to prepare for operation positions as vacancies occur.
• Participate in all process engineering aspects of capital projects.
• Actively promote safety and environmental compliance.
• Other duties as assigned.
What you will need to succeed:
• Required: BS Degree in Engineering (Chemical, Electrical or Mechanical) or Pulp and Paper Science.
• Required: Experience with Microsoft Office Suite including MS Excel
• Preferred: Minimum 2 years of industry experience on either the paper machine or pulp mill area, preferably in a process engineering role (can be combination of Co-Op / Internship, along with time in process engineering role)
• Strong verbal and written communication skills
• Physical ability to operate in paper mill environment, including light to moderate lifting, walking, and climbing, oral
communication,
correctable vision, and ability to work in a hot, humid, and dusty environment.
What we offer:
Corporate culture based on integrity, respect, a
ccountability,
and excellence.
Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development
opportunities.
An attractive salary reflecting skills, competencies, and potential.
Benefits package to include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401k with match, tuition
reimbursement,
employee discounts, employee referral bonus, and much more!
A career with a global packaging company where S
ustainability,

description_text:
General Information
Job ID
ATR57493
Posting Job Title
Offset Utility Operator 7a-7p
Locations
NC Winston-Salem Manufacturing
Employment Type
Full Time
Date Posted
22-Jan-2026
Relocation Support

Description & Requirements
Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
Offset Utility Operator - Winston Salem Manufacturing
Shift: 7am-7pm
Summary
:
The Offset Utility Operator position requires employees to operate and/or assist in the operation of various equipment in the Offset printing department. Each area requires daily forklift operation and ability to enter data into computer systems. Each area requires attention to detail.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following:
Operate Jogger and Guillotine machines, using tape measure to verify within 1/32”; operate Guillotine computer system to program desired number of cuts and location of cuts.
Operate Jogger machine and controls, putting loads on correct pallets and alignment of load on pallet, lifting of wooden and plastic pallets onto and doff loads on Jogger.
Unitize all loads from department according to inventory or shipping specifications using large panel saw, strapping bander and large drill for drilling strapping holes as needed. Loads coming off press must be same height and counts and must match press production.
Enter finished goods data for every job coming off press into AS400 inventory system and move units to proper location in the system; also issue and return jobs in system.
Operate forklift (sit down) and electric pallet jack (no truck dock-plate loading duties) to stage loads by location for shipping and manufacturing inventory.
Perform preventative maintenance on Jogger and Guillotine machines as scheduled.
Maintain clean and neat work areas at all times and follow all sanitation procedures.
Follow all Safety Rules and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP’s).
Responsible for the overall Safety and cleanliness of equipment and area.
Work in a safe and efficient manner in accordance with company policies and procedures.
Overtime is required.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Sheeter Roll Stand Job duties
(in addition to duties and responsibilities mentioned previously):
Order roll stock needed according to Sheeter schedule by notifying clamp truck driver.
Cut steel bands off roll stock and to cut waste wraps from rolls.
Unwrap rolls and use tape measure to ensure correct roll width is being loaded, use roll stock pushing machine to move roll into position to load.
Lower arms of machine into correct position, clamp roll and move into working position, thread paper into slicing head of machine and set proper brake pressure.
Unload any empty cores or left over rolls and apply correct inventory tags, or stage for proper disposal.
Move loads with electric pallet jack out of machine, place empty pallets into machine, remove trim waste from Gaylords as need and load empty Gaylords.
Operate the entire machine during breaks or while operator is absent; including using the computer system to set-up and run the job with correct sizes from the work instructions and to perform all quality checks.
Move sheeted loads to staging area for printing department.
Assist with Sheeter preventative maintenance as scheduled.
Press Helper Job duties
(in addition to duties and responsibilities mentioned previously):
Prepare plates, ink and paper for the next job on press.
Read job instructions and put the correct ink into the press and use wash-up procedures to remove ink after  job is complete.
Mount and remove blankets on press and retrieve proper coating blankets from the information on the Excel spreadsheet for location retrieval.
Operate press feed section and electronic function control board while 2
nd
press person is on break or filling in for the 1
st
press person.
Perform color and quality checks while filling in for 2
nd
press person.
Assist Press Operator with preventative maintenance as scheduled.
Supervisory Responsibilities:
This job has no supervisory responsibilities.
Qualifications
The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and/or Experience
High school diploma or GED minimum.
Language Skills
Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.  May require the ability to write routine reports and correspondence.   May require the ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization.
Mathematical Skills
Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.
Reasoning Ability
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but uninvolved written or oral instructions.  Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.
Computer Skills
To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of and basic computer skills. Requires ability to issue and return roll stock to and from jobs in AS400 inventory system and get correct footage used from Sheeter computer.
Other Qualifications
Requires the ability to react quickly and make continuous adjustments to provide top quality product.  Normal vision required for most duties; however, employee must pass a color-blind test to work on the press.  Hearing ability must be adequate and ear protection is required. Pressroom area position requires employee to pass color blind testing.
Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.

Proven analytical skills: ability to link strategies and objectives to develop a plan.
Excellent communication skills: ability to send and receive information clearly and concisely.
Superior presentation skills, both in development of compelling stories and in presenting them at all levels within customer and internal organization.
Decisive, action-oriented, and able to manage deliverables effectively. Strong sense of ownership and flexibility when operational challenges occur.
High attention to detail and proven ability to autonomously manage multiple priorities simultaneously.

Description & Requirements
Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
Position Title:
Second Press Operator
General Purpose
Responsible for performing manual and machine tasks related to the setup, maintenance, and operation of sheet-fed offset presses to accurately produce products that meet customer specifications.
Essential Job Functions
• Operate various sheet-fed offset presses.
• Read and interpret work orders to determine setup specifications and instructions.
• Start machines and run trial sets to verify accuracy of machine setups.
• Observe and monitor press operations to detect malfunctions and determine required adjustments.
• Ensure image registration from unit to unit; run samples and make adjustments to maintain print quality and color settings in accordance with densitometer readings.
• Follow all standard operating procedures applicable to the job, position, and department.
• Perform routine adjustments during press runs to maintain quality throughout production.
• Complete assigned work effectively and within required timelines.
• Accurately follow all instructions.
• Maintain daily production records using specified forms.
• Record production data including time spent on specific tasks.
• Preserve and transfer customer artwork in clean, undamaged condition.
• Maintain a clean and orderly work area.
• Open machines and remove or replace damaged product using hand tools.
• Perform daily and monthly maintenance and troubleshooting activities.
• Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
• Five to seven years of printing experience required.
• Ability to read and interpret safety rules, operating instructions, and procedure manuals.
• Basic computer skills including data entry.
• Ability to perform intermediate arithmetic including decimals, fractions, ratios, addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
• Ability to meet or pass mechanical aptitude testing or demonstrate mechanical aptitude through prior experience.
• Ability to pass color hue and color vision tests.
• Ability to read a ruler.
• Demonstrated ability to perform accurate work.
• Effective decision-making skills.
• Strong time management and self-management skills.
• Willingness to work overtime as required; significant overtime may be needed during peak periods.
• Reliable attendance required.
• Ability to perform all essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation.
Physical Demands
The physical demands described are representative of those required to perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made.
• Ability to sit, stand, walk, talk, see, and hear.

Description & Requirements
Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
Position Title:
Lead Press Operator
Department:
Pressroom
General Purpose
Perform manual and machine operator tasks related to the setup, maintenance, and operation of a printing press.
Essential Job Functions
• Read and interpret job ticket instructions and direct press setup accordingly.
• Make jobs press-ready by running sets to adjust print quality, registration, and color settings.
• Perform pre-run inspections, obtain supervisor approval, and run jobs to completion.
• Achieve color accuracy prior to requesting supervisor color approval.
• Monitor offsetting and load temperatures for various printed substrates.
• Observe and monitor press operations to detect malfunctions and determine necessary adjustments.
• Accurately follow all job and process instructions.
• Monitor pH and conductivity of fountain solution and all press-related chemistry.
• Complete all required documentation including shop floor entries, job logs, sheet counts, and running sequences.
• Supervise and train press feeders and second press operators on multi-color printing processes.
• Promote a positive team environment aligned with departmental and company objectives.
• Perform preventative maintenance including lubrication, cleaning, minor adjustments, and replacement of small parts and rollers.
• Follow all safety policies and oversee crew safety, including MSDS, Lockout/Tagout, and proper handling and disposal of hazardous materials.
• Operate or assist with other pressroom equipment and presses as needed based on workload.
• Direct pre-press tasks such as paper trimming when required.
• Assist in maintaining a clean, neat, and orderly work area.
• Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
• Strong color perception required; must pass color hue and color vision tests.
• Minimum of five years of manufacturing experience performing First Press Operator duties on sheet-fed equipment comparable to Heidelberg, including CP2000 console knowledge.
• Experience using color scanning equipment.
• Experience working with plastic substrates.
• Ability to read and interpret safety rules, operating instructions, and procedure manuals.
• Basic computer skills including data entry.
• Ability to perform basic arithmetic (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division).
• Ability to read a ruler.
• Ability to operate densitometers, spectrophotometers, calculators, computer terminals, gloss meters, pH/conductivity meters, and other printing equipment.
• Ability to work in and around UV (ultra-violet) materials.
• Demonstrated competencies in accuracy, reliability, decision-making, time management, and self-motivation.
• Reliable attendance required.
• Ability to perform all essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation.
Physical Demands
The physical demands described are representative of those required to perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made.
• Ability to sit, stand, move throughout the work area, talk, and hear.
Candidates are required to undergo a drug screening after receiving a conditional job offer, but before starting employment.

Smurfit Westrock (NYSE:SW) is a global leader in sustainable paper and packaging solutions. We are materials scientists, packaging designers, mechanical engineers and manufacturing experts with a shared purpose: Innovate Boldly. Package Sustainably. Guided by our values of integrity, respect, accountability and excellence, we use leading science and technology to move fiber-based packaging forward.
Smurfit Westrock (NYSE: SW) is the go-to sustainable packaging partner of choice. We offer an unrivaled product portfolio and bring expertise, scale, and a global presence of 500+ converting operations and 63 mills across 40 countries. Learn more at
www.smurfitwestrock.com.
We offer an unparalleled portfolio of innovative packaging solutions, ranging from corrugated and consumer packaging to Bag-in-Box® packaging and point-of-sale displays. With the circular economy at the core of our business, we use renewable, recyclable, and recycled materials to create sustainable packaging solutions.
As a trusted partner to companies across the world, Smurfit Westrock is dedicated to creating efficient and scalable paper and packaging solutions to help solve complex packaging challenges. We are committed to delivering meaningful value for shareholders, customers, employees, and the communities where we operate.
Location and/or Business/Division Details (if applicable)
Title:
Technical Trainer (OPTTS3)
Job Summary:
The Technical Trainer assists with training processes locally. The role reports into the site Supervisor, Technical Trainers OR the General Manager (depending on size/scope of plant) and dotted lines into Operations Learning & Development, to ensure training is completed for Operator/ Craft Job Certification. The role will be a key contact/ trainer for team members and be responsible for teammate assessments regarding machine skills – providing feedback, machine certification responsibility, and conducting assessments related to line of progression movements.
Major
Job
Responsibilities:
Completes daily technical training on the floor to assist with the Certification of team members in their roles
Partners with the site leadership team to support New Hire Orientation/ On Boarding Training
Owns tracking, evaluating, and measuring training locally using the company’s Dept. Training Standards & Learning System tools
Supports site specific technical learning solution creation (SOP’s, Guided Workflows, Technical Learning Aids - to assist with training)
Develops, builds, and maintains relationships with trainees & leaders in their role
Participates in new teammate hiring process – assesses candidates’ skills (general and/ or machine, involved in interview process to assess industrial experience, and provides perspective on hiring decisions)
Conducts training on all shifts
Influences others to be safety-minded
Team members will be certified through a Train the Trainer process, support managing day-to-day Certification Processes & will be supported by Ops L&D with training tools & general knowledge content
Additional duties as assigned
How you will impact WestRock:
Improve local team performance through increasing skills and time to certification processes
Cost eliminator driving training efficiencies across roles, saving us unnecessary risk, and reducing the time allotted for training – a continuous improvement mindset

Critical
Skills/ Capabilities:
Growth
and

Results oriented person that looks for constant ways to improve

Able to support implementation of new processes and new learning technologies to drive training into the flow of work

Possess keen awareness and understanding of the importance of strong interpersonal skills in communicating, achieving OKR’s and leading people or teams (self-awareness)

Holds self and others responsible for actions and results

Communication:
Willingness to work on the floor, with all shifts, in a heavy manufacturing world, to ensure we can document and teach critical work processes

Actively work to ensure quality is ensured while minimizing waste

Skills:
1 – 3 years’ experience conducting/ leading training, including On-The-Job training, or similar, in a manufacturing environment preferred
